messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Madeline
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s a shop in my area which sells British stuff; you can even buy jumbo sized bottles of Brown Sauce  :-P Nancy, who had the most memorable meals in
messages.messageBody:
on 1/9/02 12:51 AM, meghan anderson at moonmeghan@... wrote:

> <<<<If you hunt on the internet, you may be able to
> find copies of the
> Madeline books translated into French.
>
> Betsy>>>>
>
> Thanks Betsy,
> We actually have two Madeline books in French. They're
> pretty easy to find in the UK (where we moved from).
> In fact, there's a shop in Brighton that specialises
> in selling French items (and things associated with
> France). They will also order you anything French that
> your little heart desires.
>
> Meghan

There's a shop in my area which sells British stuff; you can even buy jumbo
sized bottles of Brown Sauce :-P

Nancy, who had the most memorable meals in England...

messages.subject: Re: Madeline
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Betsy, We actually have two
messages.messageBody:
<<<<If you hunt on the internet, you may be able to
find copies of the
Madeline books translated into French.

Betsy>>>>

Thanks Betsy,
We actually have two Madeline books in French. They're
pretty easy to find in the UK (where we moved from).
In fact, there's a shop in Brighton that specialises
in selling French items (and things associated with
France). They will also order you anything French that
your little heart desires.

Meghan
